Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails - 1 Day Doi Inthanon

Experience a completely off the beaten track hiking trail in Doi Inthanon National Park, rich in fauna and flora. Incredibly scenic and non touristic. Here you will hike one of a kind special hiking trails. Hiking 4 - 5 hours through the heart of the rain forests. Visit waterfalls, view points and even have the chance to see Gibbons in the Doi Inthanon National Park. and learn about the traditional herbal medicine used for centuries in home made saunas by the Karen Hilltribe.

Quick Facts

Price: THB 1,900
Duration: 11 hours
Meal(s): Meals
Difficulty: Medium, has a mix of uphills and downhills
Seasonal: Available November - February

More Info

Pick Up & Drop Off

Pick up from your hotel between 7.30 - 8.00 am. Drop off in Chiang Mai around 6.00 - 6.30 pm.

Included

Pick up and drop off from your hotel, lunch, water, English-speaking guide, park fees and insurance.

Not Included

Extra snacks or soft drinks.

What to Bring

Wear shoes with grip suitable for trekking and climbing, swimsuit for enjoying at the waterfall and pack a warm layer, mornings can be chilly at the summit.

Please support our mission by booking your trek directly with us on this site or by calling us instead of through a tour agency.

Highlights

  • Explore Doi Inthanon National Park
  • Learn about flora, fauna, and jungle survival from your guide
  • See viewpoints from the tallest mountain in Thailand
  • Enjoy the beauty of waterfalls

Itinerary:

  • Pick up from your hotel between 7.00 - 7.30 am, drive to Hoi Tong Karen Hilltribe village
  • Stop at a local market along the journey to get supplies and take a restroom break.
  • Arrive in Hoi Tong Karen Hilltribe village and head to the starting point of the hiking trail.
  • Trek approximately 5 hours through the borders of Doi Inthanon and Mae Wang National Parks. Along the way, stop at a beautiful waterfall, experience the beauty of the rainforests fauna and flora and take in breathtaking views at the viewpoint. If you are lucky you may see monkeys and even Gibbons.
  • Stop for lunch along the trail.
  • Visit a farm where we will show you different medicinal herbs that the Karen hilltribe people have been using for centuries in homemade steam rooms.
  • Leave to arrive in Chiang Mai around 6.30 pm.

Notes:

Please note that trails and stops may change due to weather and seasonal conditions, or depending on fitness levels of the group.
